clinical_study.brief_title: A Study on a Multidimensional Prediction Model for Rupture Risk of Unruptured Intracranial Aneurysms
clinical_study.official_title: This is a Registry Study on a Multidimensional Prediction Model for Rupture Risk of Unruptured Intracranial Aneurysms in China

collaborator.agency: Ministry of Science and Technology of the People's Repubic of China

brief_summary.textblock: This is a registry study on a multidimensional prediction model for rupture risk of unruptured intracranial aneurysms in China.

detailed_description.textblock:
An intracranial aneurysm is swelling along a blood vessel. Ruptured aneurysms, the most common cause of nontraumatic subarachnoid hemorrhage, can be catastrophic and have high mortality and morbidity rates. The key points of prevention and cure of unruptured intracranial aneurysms (UIA) are: (1) clarify the natural history of UIA patients and (2) clarify the risk factors of aneurysms. Furthermore, understanding how to reduce the rate of rupture, and thus reduce patient mortality, has become a key problem to be solved in this field. The aim of this study is to establish a multidimensional model for predicting the rupture of unruptured aneurysms.
The investigators will first establish a prospective cohort of patients with UIA from 20 different grade centers selected randomly in China, and collect baseline information for each patient. Multidimensional data will be acquired in follow-up assessments. Based on the original prediction system and the central laboratory and international uniform experimental technical specification, the risk factors related to the rupture of UIA, including genes, biomarkers, high resolution magnetic resonance images (HRMRI), hemodynamics and clinical features will be analyzed. These data will then be used to further improve the prediction model of UIA rupture risk.
After refinement of the model, the evidence-based prediction will provide a theoretical basis for the treatment of aneurysms with high rupture risk, so as to improve the prevention and control of UIA and avoid uninformed treatment.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 12 months or time of aneurysm repair surgery
primary_outcome.description: The rupture of unruptured intracranial aneurysms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in morphology of unruptured intracranial aneurysms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 12 months or time of aneurysm repair surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum diameter increase ≥ 1mm or appearance of a daughter sac.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with at least 1 UIA that is untreated and confirmed by imaging (CTA, MRA and DSA), regardless of the presence of clinical symptoms.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- At least 1 UIA that is untreated and confirmed by imaging: Computed tomography angiography (CTA), magnetic resonance angiography (MRA) and digital subtraction angiography (DSA). Regardless of the presence of clinical symptoms
- Patient currently has the ability to live independently, and a modified Ranking Score less than or equal to 3 points
- Older than 14 years of age
- Patient or relatives agreed to sign the consent form
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subarachnoid hemorrhage of unknown origin
- Presence of other intracranial vascular malformations, such as cerebral arteriovenous malformation (AVM) or cerebral arteriovenous fistula (AVF)
- Intracranial and other malignant tumors
- Fusiform, traumatic, bacterial or dissecting aneurysm
- Patients with severe mental illness who are unable to communicate
- Patients with other diseases or poor general condition who are expected to survive less than 1 year
- Patients with intracranial aneurysms who have joined other similar research institutions
- Patients who refused follow-up
The definition of modified Ranking Score:
- 0 Completely silent
- 1 Despite symptoms, but not visibly disabled, can complete all regular duties and activities
- 2 Mild disabilities, not all activities previously possible, but can deal with personal affairs without need of assistance
- 3 Moderate disability requires some help, but walking does not need assistance;
- 4 Severe disabilities, unable to walk independently, no others can not meet their needs
- 5 Severely disabled, bedridden, Urine, requiring continuous care and care;
- 6 Mortality
